Description: Iraq invades Kuwait; major supply disruption.
Currency devaluations lead to massive demand drop in Asia.
OPEC cuts supply to combat low prices after Asian crisis.
Immediate aviation halt and global economic uncertainty.
US-led invasion of Iraq creating supply uncertainty.
Brent hits $147 due to speculation and emerging market demand.
Global Financial Crisis triggers massive demand destruction.
Protests in MENA region; Libyan oil production stops.
US shale output surges; OPEC refuses to cut supply to kill competition.
OPEC and Russia agree to historic cuts to stabilize the market.
Re-imposition of sanctions on Iranian oil exports.
Saudi Arabia and Russia fail to agree on cuts; price war begins during pandemic.
Storage capacity runs out; massive demand crash due to global lockdowns.
Rapid demand recovery outstrips supply as economies reopen.
Russia invades Ukraine; Western sanctions on Russian energy exports.
